programme.desc: As tourist numbers continue to rise worldwide, African wildlife parks are facing unprecedented challenges. programme.title: Winter's Hidden Wonders
programme.desc: The harsh elements of the Americas' winter push animals to their limits. Only the toughest and most resourceful survive.

programme.title: Winter's Hidden Wonders
programme.desc: Winter in Europe sees temperatures plummet to minus 40 degrees; wildlife pushed to the extreme. Animals here have little choice but to adapt or die.

programme.title: Katavi - Africa's Fallen Paradise

In the crushing heat, life desperately struggles to hold out for rain.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads into the mangroves to discover which animal is truly built to survive the mud and muck. He encounters a feisty mud crab with huge pincers and catches a shovel-nosed ray with his bare hands. Finally, Phil faces a creature we all love to hate‚Äîthe mosquito‚Äîand discovers there‚Äôs more to these tiny bloodsuckers than meets the eye.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Within the Channel Country deserts, Indigenous educator Phil Breslin scours the endless sands to find three animals that not only survive the heat but thrive in unrelenting conditions. Get ready to meet Australia‚Äôs most impressive animals: the perentie, the continent‚Äôs largest lizard; the emu, its fastest flightless bird; and the mighty red kangaroo, the world‚Äôs largest marsupial.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: On the edge of the Sahara Desert in Mali, a society struggles to thrive. This isn't a society of humans but of rare desert elephants. More than just a herd of animals, they are a tribe of extended families and comrades with their own unique culture.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: In Africa's vast Serengeti Plain, one million wildebeest are taking a rare pause for the mothers to have their young in a massive birthing event. .

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: When you've got it all, why would you give it all up? We expect animals to take the path of least resistance -- choosing the easiest and surest ways to get food, safety and comfort. But animals aren't always so predictable.

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: The hyena, much maligned and misunderstood, is no slobbering scavenger. It's a calculating killer: as smart as a primate, as lethal as a lion. Built for the Kill: Hyena follows the transformation of a tiny cub into an accomplished hunter; exposing real life and death struggles in dramatic second-by-second detail. .

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo: Tampa: Compilation
programme.desc: Buckle up for an exciting adventure across the plains of Africa ‚Äî Zoo Tampa style! In this action-packed episode, African animals take center stage as the zoo welcomes its first female giraffe, elephant intelligence and cooperation are put to the test, and a new rhino calf is born.

programme.title: Monkey Wars
programme.desc: The Simien Mountains in Ethiopia are home to geladas, the only monkey in the world that grazes. They form large and powerful family groups with complex social hierarchies and fickle relationships. Young bachelor males yearn for power, and when the time is right, they take their chance to grab it with great violence. The alpha male faces a world of pressure on his shoulders.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol & Diane welcome a new Friesian filly to the family. Dr. Lisa handles two Corgi emergencies, and Dr. Olivia gets help treating two dogs with curious wounds. programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol

programme.title: Built For The Kill
programme.desc: Grizzly bears are 1000 pounds of muscle, teeth, and claw. Grizzly cubs are just 1 pound of blind, toothless fluff. programme.title: Jane Goodall: The Hope

programme.title: Crocodile - Australia's Greatest Survivor
programme.desc: In Australia, dominant saltwater crocodiles, called 'boss crocs,‚Äù are the largest and most powerful animals on the continent. Even after unrelenting human pressure on their very survival, they are still the masters of their world. Over the last 200 years, the impact of human activities‚Äîsuch as commercial hunting, agriculture and population growth‚Äîpushed them to the brink of extinction.

programme.title: Day Of The Dragon
programme.desc: The clock starts just before sunrise - when the temperature begins to rise. It‚Äôs hard work being the world‚Äôs biggest lizard on Rinca island. For the biggest male on the island, an ever- warming environment and shrinking hunting grounds threaten his survival across every hour of the day.

programme.title: Florida Untamed: Where Reptiles Rule Compilation
programme.desc: Beyond the idyllic beaches and theme parks, there is a battleground where wildlife fights for survival.
